org.chemicalmozart.model.implementations.reactionrules

Class StartMelodicRR

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.chemicalmozart.model.implementations.reactionrules.StartMelodicRR
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReactionRule

    public class StartMelodicRR
extends java.lang.Object
implements ReactionRule
    This ReactionRule needs the following elements to react :
    • SubSolution "BarInCreation"
      • BarInCreation : Object that indicates that the current solution represents a bar in creation.
      • BarNumber : The BarNumber of the current selected solution.
    • BarNumber : Represents the next BarNumber which will be used for the melodic generation.
    • Pitch : Represents the last note played.

    This reaction rule adds to the bar in creation a RythmicRR and a MelodicRR. It must also add a Solution which contains some available rhythm for 2 and 4 quaters per time. This solution can be obtained by the MozartSolutionFactory.createRythmicPull().
    The pitch must also be added to the BarInCreation. It will be used to determine the last note played.

      • computeResult

        public java.lang.Object[] computeResult()
        Adds to the solution contained in _sol a RythmicRR and a MelodicRR and _pitch. It also add the result of MozartSolutionFactory.createRythmicPull() to _sol.
        There is no need to put back BarInCreation in _sol. We will not use it in the future. On the contrary, it's important to put back the BarNumber in _sol.
        It must also return directly a BarNumber after having increased its value.
        Specified by:
        computeResult in interface ReactionRule
        Returns:
        an Object array containing what should be reinjected in the solution at the end of the reaction.

      • computeSelect

        public boolean computeSelect()
        Controls that the good elements are matched. It must verify that the BarNumber object has the same value as the BarNumber object in the subsolution. If this is the case, the function returns true.
        Specified by:
        computeSelect in interface ReactionRule
        Returns:
        true if the present reagents are compatible with the reaction.
